Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed finished the contest with four wickets, conceding 25 runs.
Mosaddek Hossain hit a 12-ball 20 cameo towards the end, helping Bangladesh post a fighting total.
Bangladesh bowlers and fielders put a strong show, reducing Netherlands to 15/4 inside four overs.
Scott Edwards and Colin Ackermann showed some resistance, but Shakib Al Hasan packed Edwards for 16.
Colin Ackermann led a lone battle and went to smash 62 off 48 balls.
Despite his knock, Netherlands could only manage 135/10, with the last wicket falling in the final ball of the 20th over.
Post-Match Reflections: Netherlands are bundled out for 135 in response to Bangladesh's 144/8.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh beat Netherlands by 9 runs in a low-scoring Super 12 encounter of the T20 World Cup in Hobart on Monday.

The opening pair of Najmul Hossain Shanto and Soumya Sarkar got Bangladesh off to a strong start, however, following their dismissal the Asian side failed to carry forward the momentum and lost wickets at regular intervals.
